get.description: See {IERC20-allowance}.

post.description: See {IERC20-allowance}.

get.description: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

post.description: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

get.description: See {IERC20-balanceOf}.

post.description: See {IERC20-balanceOf}.

get.description: Destroys `amount` tokens from the caller. See {ERC20-_burn}.

post.description: Destroys `amount` tokens from the caller. See {ERC20-_burn}.

get.description: Destroys `amount` tokens from `account`, deducting from the caller's allowance. See {ERC20-_burn} and {ERC20-allowance}. Requirements: - the caller must have allowance for ``accounts``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

post.description: Destroys `amount` tokens from `account`, deducting from the caller's allowance. See {ERC20-_burn} and {ERC20-allowance}. Requirements: - the caller must have allowance for ``accounts``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

get.description: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

post.description: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

get.description: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

post.description: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

get.description: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

post.description: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

get.description: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

post.description: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

get.description: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

post.description: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

get.description: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

post.description: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

get.description: Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`.

post.description: Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`.

get.description: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

post.description: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

get.description: Returns the name of the token.

post.description: Returns the name of the token.

get.description: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

post.description: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

get.description: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

post.description: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

get.description: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

post.description: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

get.description: See {IERC20-totalSupply}.

post.description: See {IERC20-totalSupply}.

get.description: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

post.description: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

get.description: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}; Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

post.description: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}; Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

acktypeParam.description: Set to 'receipt' to store a receipt before acknowledging an async request (header: x-kaleido-acktype)
acktypeParam.name: kld-acktype

blocknumberParam.description: The target block number for eth_call requests. One of 'earliest/latest/pending', a number or a hex string (header: x-kaleido-blocknumber)
blocknumberParam.name: kld-blocknumber

callParam.description: Perform a read-only call with the same parameters that would be used to invoke, and return result (header: x-kaleido-call)
callParam.name: kld-call

gasParam.description: Gas to send with the transaction (auto-calculated if not set) (header: x-kaleido-gas)
gasParam.name: kld-gas

idParam.description: Optionally set the ID for this request - must be unique if set (header: x-kaleido-id)
idParam.name: kld-id

privateForParam.description: Private transaction recipients (comma separated or multiple params) (header: x-kaleido-privatefor)
privateForParam.name: kld-privatefor

registerParam.description: Register the installed contract on a friendly path (overwrites existing) (header: x-kaleido-register)
registerParam.name: kld-register

syncParam.description: Block the HTTP request until the tx is mined (does not store the receipt) (header: x-kaleido-sync)
syncParam.name: kld-sync

transactionParam.description: Query the details for the provided transaction hash (header: x-kaleido-transaction)
transactionParam.name: kld-transaction

valueParam.description: Ether value to send with the transaction (header: x-kaleido-ethvalue)
valueParam.name: kld-ethvalue
